webrtc/RTCDataChannel-GC.html.comment: Tests timeout in Safari (and can't easily be replicated in a non-test environment). FF fails.

webrtc/RTCPeerConnection-mandatory-getSt.comment: Of the relevant stats (trackIdentifier, totalSamplesDuration, packetsDiscarded, responsesReceived), only responsesReceived (#2832) lacks a 2nd implementation (only in Chromium atm); no relevant bugs in FF/Webkit trackers

webrtc/RTCRtpParameters-encodings.html.comment:
• TypeError unless all or none of encodings have rids, duplicate rids (#2774 #2775) only in Firefox
  • Adjustments to scaleResolutionDownBy (#2772) only in Firefox

webrtc/idlharness.https.window.html.comment:
• RTCIceCandate.relayProtocol (#2763) only in Chromium
  • RTCIceCandate.url (#2773) only in Chromium
  • RTCIceCandidatePair (#2961) not implemented

webrtc/simulcast/negotiation-encodings.h.comment:
• #2800 (duplicate rids), #2813 (alternative rids) fail everywhere
  • #2797 (rollback) passes only in FF

webrtc/RTCPeerConnection-addTcpIceCandid.comment: Chromium/Safari failing test on part of bad ports; FF failing to ignore bad port on addIceCandidate?

webrtc/RTCDataChannel-send.html.comment: not sure why Safari times out on wpt.fyi, but it passes all tests when run locally; Chromium passes the tests relevant to the amendment

webrtc/RTCPeerConnection-createDataChann.comment: Safari and Chromium pass the amendment relevant tests

webrtc/RTCConfiguration-iceTransportPoli.comment: test failures in Chromium/Safari are unrelated to the amendment

webrtc/RTCPeerConnection-iceGatheringSta.comment: 2894-relevant tests fail in Chromium and Safari

webrtc/RTCRtpTransceiver-setCodecPrefere.comment: 2975-relevant tests fail in Chromium and Safari
